de.szut.dqi12.cheftrainer.server.databasecommunication

Class DatabaseUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.szut.dqi12.cheftrainer.server.databasecommunication.DatabaseUtils

  • public class DatabaseUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides a few simple method, to communicate with the database or to check ResultSets.
    Author:
    Alexander Brennecke

    • Method Detail

      • isResultSetEmpty

        public boolean isResultSetEmpty(java.sql.ResultSet rs)
        This method checks, if the given ResultSet is empty|has zero rows
        Parameters:
        rs - the ResultSet, that should be checked.
        Returns:
        true = the ResultSet is empty.

      • clearTable

        public void clearTable(java.lang.String tableName)
        This function will create a query, that will delete all information, stored in the given database table.
        Parameters:
        tableName - the name of the table, that will be cleared.

      • getManagerID

        public int getManagerID(int userID,
                        int communityID)
        This function creates a query and sends it to the database. The ResultSet will show the Manager ID for the given User in the given Community;
        Parameters:
        userID - the ID of the User, that owns the Manager
        communityID - the ID of the Community, in which the Manager plays
        Returns:
        the ID of the searched Manager or -1, if no Manager was found.

      • getManagerID

        public int getManagerID(int userID,
                        java.lang.String communityName)
        This function creates a query and sends it to the database. The ResultSet will show the Manager ID for the given User in the given Community;
        Parameters:
        userID - the ID of the User, that owns the Manager
        communityName - the name of the Community, in which the Manager plays
        Returns:
        the ID of the searched Manager or -1, if no Manager was found.

      • getTeamNameForID

        public java.lang.String getTeamNameForID(int id)
        This method searches for the name of the team with the given ID.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the team.
        Returns:
        the name of the team or "", when there was no team with the given ID

      • getUniqueValue

        public java.lang.Object getUniqueValue(java.lang.String coloumName,
                                       java.lang.String table,
                                       java.lang.String whereCondition)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        This method can be used to get exactly one value from the database.
        Parameters:
        coloumName - the name of the coloum
        table - the name of the table
        whereCondition - the search condition (without where)
        Returns:
        the value as Object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there is no value, that matches the condition.

      • sendSimpleQuery

        public void sendSimpleQuery(java.lang.String query)
        This method sends the Query to the database.
        Parameters:
        query - the Query, that should be send to the database.

      • getTeamIDForName

        public int getTeamIDForName(java.lang.String teamName)
        this function reads the ID of a RealTeam with the given name.
        Parameters:
        teamName - the name of the RealTeam
        Returns:
        the ID of the RealTeam

      • getListFromResultSet

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getListFromResultSet(java.sql.ResultSet rs,
                                                                     java.lang.String column)
                                                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        This function iterates over the given ResultSet and creates a Integer List from the values in the given column (must be integer values)
        Parameters:
        rs - a active ResultSet
        column - the name of the column in the ResultSet
        Returns:
        a List of Integer values, which were read out of the column.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
